I would have hoped for a more serious answer jonny...of cource I can buy the discs, but I just want to know why you convert them into 720p.

Personally, I prefer 720p torrents.  The reason being is that I stream these files from my computer to ps3 to t.v.  1080p is just too bitrate intensive to stream smoothly (even more so when audio is DTS)...even with a i7 p.c./wired network.  So I appreciate and only download the 720p releases.  And besides, I can only see a minor video quality difference between 720 and 1080.  Yes, there is a difference, but to me it is not worth the extra hard drive space nor network bandwidth when streaming.  I couldn't say for sure, but I think these might be some of the reasons that 720p is so popular in the torrent scene.  720p is after all, still High Def.

Anybody experiencing a lack of English Audio when watching this on a WDTV setup?  Channel 2 (Chinese) works just fine.  I use HDMI cables and have updated the WDTV setup to the newest firmware.

In refrence my above problem, I figured it out.  In case anybody else runs into it, WDTV is incapable of playing DTS audio files so I downloaded PopCorn MKV AudioConverter (google it) and converted the audio files to AC3 and now it works on my WDTV.  All in all, it took about an hour.  -jonny- provided a great upload here.

In reference my above problem, I figured it out.  In case anybody else runs into it, WDTV is incapable of playing DTS audio files so I downloaded PopCorn MKV AudioConverter (Google it) and converted the audio files to AC3 and now it works on my WDTV.  All in all, it took about an hour.  -jonny- provided a great upload here.

Not actually 720p because 720p = 1280 x 720

This is 1280 x 532 this is based of sample not the whole movie but I'll assume it's the same.

@VYCanisMajoris

The aspect ratio of the movie is 2:40:1, you can't fit that in 1920x1080 or 1080x720; that's why it's 1280x534.

VYCanisMajoris - This is of 720p HD Class. The movie itself is more narrow then true 720p. At 532p this just means the format is not 16/9 and maybe a bit more narrow but what is important is that it is 1280 which is across and that determines the HD Class of whats known to be a 720p movie.
